intro: Narcissus romieuxii, commonly known as the Corsican daffodil, is a rare and striking bulbous plant native to Corsica. It features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow with a white throat, blooming in early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to grow in rocky or well-drained soils. It is classified as a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is valued for its ornamental beauty. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native region.
